originalText.text:
Had an appointment in the rheumatology department. If they are running late they will not give you any updates unless you ask. There was a snow storm yesterday, they told me to come early. 1.5 hours of waiting I finally go up to get an update and the nurse laughs in my face telling me dr Rackoff is late and the next patient will need to wait at least another 40 minutes and wouldnâ€™t even tell me if I was the next patient as she laughed her way back into the doctors office (all this after they cancelled my appointment last minute 2 months ago. So I actually waited 4 months for this appointment, hopefully Iâ€™m not dying).

When it was finally my turn (3 hours wait) I had just finished reading all the reviews of my doctor and came to the conclusion that sheâ€™s elitist and very possibly racist. Big shout out to NYU Langone for hiring awful humans like Dr Rackoff. Thanks but no thanks. Iâ€™ll take my chance waiting another 4 months for someone else than risk my life in this awful womanâ€™s hands.

originalText.text: I've been to several PT places but never felt as respected and heard as I did at NYU Langone. I can't say enough positive things about the therapist I worked with. Also, all of therapists and assistants are very nice and quite helpful. Also, they don't take themselves to seriously that you feel they're uptight... which is a breath of fresh air. Another thing I liked about them is they care about how you do the exercises. They teach you the proper breathing, positions, and make sure you are doing everything correctly.  The front desk staff is awesome as well.

originalText.text: I love this location. My doctor is the best I ever had. I travel 1hr & 15 mins but well worth it for the excellent care. Doctor, Gary Ho is so kind & understanding. I never feel rushed out the office. He actually listens to me an takes his time with questions or concerns that i have. He does a thorough blood count! He is very gentle with injections ðŸ’‰ knowing I'm ðŸ˜± scared of needles. Yes, my grown self hides my faceðŸ«£ attends to shakeðŸ¥² but i barely feel a thing! Trust me!

originalText.text: I've been going for physical therapy on the 5th floor on-and-off for the past three years for botched foot surgeries. I'm in the NYU system so the process of getting an initial appointment was an easy process. The waiting area can get full but the front desk has an efficient system of checking us in. Every one of the physical therapists I've been assigned to over the years has been knowledgeable and friendly. This place was recommended to me and I suggest it as well.

originalText.text:
I get all my medical care through NYU Langone. I go th physical therapy at this building, and see 2 of my orthopedists here.
Beautiful building, friendly staff .
Nice cafe in lobby - try their great soups
